docs.snippet: A few days after Monday’s anniversary of Jackie Robinson’s debut with the Brooklyn Dodgers, Cooperstown, N.Y., will dedicate a street to Bud Fowler, a much earlier player who helped integrate the game....
docs.lead_paragraph: A few days after Monday’s anniversary of Jackie Robinson’s debut with the Brooklyn Dodgers, Cooperstown, N.Y., will dedicate a street to Bud Fowler, a much earlier player who helped integrate the game.
docs.abstract: Cooperstown, NY, home of Baseball Hall of Fame, will dedicate street to Bud Fowler, who has gone largely unnoticed, despite being first African-American known to have played for white professional baseball team several decades before Jackie Robinson's debut with Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947.

headline.seo: Cooperstown to Honor Baseball Pioneer Bud Fowler
headline.main: Acclaim Comes Late for Baseball Pioneer
headline.print_headline: Acclaim Comes Late For Baseball Pioneer

docs.snippet: BAIRD--Annette Feder, age 89 passed away on April 5, 2013 in Summit, NJ a week before her 90th birthday. Annette was a vivacious, vibrant lover of life and humankind. She graduated from Queens College and worked as a chemist for Columbia Universit...
docs.lead_paragraph: BAIRD--Annette Feder, age 89 passed away on April 5, 2013 in Summit, NJ a week before her 90th birthday. Annette was a vivacious, vibrant lover of life and humankind. She graduated from Queens College and worked as a chemist for Columbia University and General Foods before raising two children and later becoming a devoted volunteer guide at The Boston Museum of Science. There, for over 25 years, she gave tours and specialized in electron microscope demonstrations. Visiting school groups were a special treat for her. Annette enjoyed baseball, jazz, and theater - and had a lifelong love of the arts, science, literature, and learning - which she shared with her beloved husband Donald (her partner for 59-years), her children Allison Fox and Douglas Baird, and her grandchildren Katie and Julian Fox and Gregory Baird. Annette will be dearly missed and remembered always with great love.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BAIRD, ANNETTE FEDER
